ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] What location to return on 202 (asynchronous process) and what polling result?
ygData.msgSnippet: As Aristotle replied, Location header is unspecified for 202 (Accepted). Instead, provide a body such as the following:

Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] What location to return on 202 (asynchronous process) and what polling result?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=343278744; y=9t_1tLTWkI7u4rjxznr7ysMdnmYrt5m6S2cJycBGn0qVJMQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: sallamar

As Aristotle replied, Location header is unspecified for 202  
(Accepted). =
Instead, provide a body such as the following:

<status>
   <link href=3D"h=
ttp://example.org/stats?someid"/>
   ...
</status>

so that the client can =
check the status of the response. If the  
process succeeded in creating a =
resource, only then provide a link to  
the newly created resource, which y=
ou can do as part of the status  
check response. That is, don't advertise =
/backups/version_x until the  
resource has been created. Here is a possibl=
e flow:

POST /something =3D=3D=3D> 202 Accepted + link to a status check U=
RL with in  
the response
GET /status_check_url =3D> 200 OK + status respon=
se, when not completed
GET /status_check_url =3D> 200 OK + status response,=
 when completed, but  
was not successful
GET /status_check_url =3D> 300 Se=
e Other + Location: uri_to_resource,   
when competed successfully

Subbu

=
On Sep 6, 2008, at 1:21 PM, bierstuebl wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> I'm new to thi=
s mailing list and to be honest: I've neve been on a
> mailing list before.=
 So in case I'm doing things wrong, please be
> forgiving.
>
> However, her=
e is my first question:
>
> I would like to use asynchronous REST by POSTin=
g a request to e.g.
> /backups (for creating a new backup version), which w=
ill return me a
> 202 with a location in the header. What should this locat=
ion look  
> like?
> I think it should look like /backups/version_x and NOT=
 be somewhere
> else like /queue/backups/version_x or the like.
> However, =
if a client starts polling now on /backups/version_x and the
> process hasn=
't finished yet, what should be returned? A 404 with a
> body until the pro=
cess is finished an the real representation can be
> sent with 200?
>
> Usi=
ng a new resource like /queue/backups/version I could return a 200
> with s=
ome status information in it. However, the client initially
> requested a r=
epresentation of a backup, but when it starts polling on
> the new resource=
 it receives another representation, the a status
> representeation. How co=
uld a client adjust to this situation without
> knowing in advance that the=
 action would be asynchronous??
>
> Hmm, it's difficult to describe the pro=
blem. I hope it's
> understandable somehow.
>
> regards,
> Roland
>
>
